title.narrative: Church Appeal FundsLivelihood Support to IDPs and Host Community in Tonj North County, Warrap State.

description.narrative: Trocaire has allocated some funds to respond to the needs of the displaced and vulnerable members of the host community who are affected by localized conflict in Tonj North of Warrap state. The funds is coming from the Church Appeal Funds, and will be implemented by farmer CTP partner (HARD), based in Wau. Through this intervention HARD will directly target 2000 HH smallholder farmers who are Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) and host community Households (HHs) to be supported with farm inputs (seeds and hand tools) in the coming agriculture season (2022). 10% of these will be people with disability. 500 HHs of vulnerable members of the community including pregnant and lactating mothers will be supported through CVAs with unconditional cash transfer to enable them have access to food and other basic needs. 1000 HHs will be supported with WASH NFIs, and 300 HHs with access to fishing grounds will be supported with fishing kits. Protect, PSS, VSLA and peace building dialogues will be organized and provided in all project locations. The project will be complimented by funding from Passionists for East Africa Hunger Crisis.
